summary: This bill, the "PLO and PA Terror Payments Accountability Act of 2025," aims to impose sanctions on foreign individuals and entities that support terrorism by providing financial assistance, salaries, or benefits to terrorists and their families through the Palestinian Liberation Organization (PLO) and Palestinian Authority (PA). It mandates the President to identify and sanction these actors, including through asset freezes and visa restrictions. The bill also targets foreign financial institutions facilitating such transactions. The sanctions can be lifted if the PLO and PA cease these payments, as certified by the Secretary of State.
